data.event: Limbe was founded in 1858 on the southern slopes of Mount Cameroon by the British missionary Alfred Saker.

event.title: was founded by the British missionary Alfred Saker of the Baptist Missionary Society of London in June 1858

data.event: Victoria was founded by the British missionary Alfred Saker of the Baptist Missionary Society of London in June 1858.

event.title: May 7, 1886 Great Britain and Germany agreed

data.event: On May 7, 1886 Great Britain and Germany agreed to exchange Victoria and its vicinity for German rights at the Forcados River in Nigeria and St. Lucia in South Africa.

event.title: March 28, 1887 Victoria and its vicinity were handed

data.event: On March 28, 1887 Victoria and its vicinity were handed over to the German administration.

event.title: bought the land from the Baptist Missionary Society in 1887

data.event: At the same time Swiss Presbyterian missionaries bought the land from the Baptist Missionary Society in 1887.
In 1982 Victoria was renamed and is since then known as Limbe.
